messages.message:
I mean, that’s the same page. That is, both of those urls go to the same file; the file isn’t duplicated.

Any suggestions as to a solution, if one is needed?
Do we need two different urls with the same page?
No, but I would think any page that’s an index page would be reachable by either URL: domain/whatever/ or domain/whatever/index.html
I’m unaware of anything unique about that page.

a very quick google tells me this: A better methodology for duplicate pages would simply be to mark your index.html page as cononical with your home page. This would avoid the redirect altogether but tells search engines that your index.html is intentionally duplicate with your home page and that the home page is the original/preferred source.
right now they are both crawled by google
Sure, we can mark pages as canonical. Can you tell me more about why this is important?
duplicates mark down our authority score with google

site health is being measured and determines your overall quality anmd authority score. Duplicates is 1 element of that. A high authority and health score lowers our ad costs as we are more competitive
Okay, thanks! We’ll look at this.
